description: Strand units: Representing and interpreting data

teaching.topicContent: Introduction to multiple bar charts to represent data with multiple categories. Learn about the mode, the most frequently occurring item in a data set. Collect and represent data using multiple bar charts and identify modes.
Introduction to pie charts as a way to represent data as proportions of a whole. Look at examples and discuss the significance of each sector in a pie chart.

teaching.topicTitle: Identifying Possible Outcomes of Random Processes
teaching.topicContent: Introduction to the concept of possible outcomes in random processes. Engage in discussions and list all possible outcomes of rolling a dice, tossing two coins, and drawing cubes from a bag.
Present scenarios where probability plays a role, such as games of chance. Calculate probabilities based on the number of possible outcomes.
